      • intercept

        @CheckReturnValue
public HandlerRegistration intercept(String category,
                                                       LogHandler handler)
        Ability to intercept log messages logged under a category
        Parameters:
        category - the logger category name (a.b.c)
        handler - the log handler to register.
        Returns:
        a registration handle, that you can use to unregister.

      • collect

        @CheckReturnValue
public <T> LogCollection<T> collect(String category,
                                                      Level fromLevel,
                                                      boolean passThrough,
                                                      Collector<LogRecord,?,T> collector)
        Collect a bunch of logs.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to collect into.
        Parameters:
        category - the log category (a.b.c)
        fromLevel - from level to collect.
        passThrough - pass the logs to lower category handlers or not.
        collector - the collector to collect the logs.
        Returns:
        collected logs.

        Parameters:
        category - the log category (a.b.c)
        fromLevel - from level to collect.
        toLevel - to level to collect.
        passThrough - pass the logs to lower category handlers or not.

        collected logs.

        @CheckReturnValue
public HandlerRegistration interceptAllLevels(String category,
                                                                AllLevelsLogHandler handler)
        Convenience method for functional use.
        Parameters:
        category - the log category.
        handler - a functional handler.
        Returns:
        a registration handle to allow you to undo the registration.

      • ignore

        @CheckReturnValue
public HandlerRegistration ignore(String category,
                                                    Level from,
                                                    Level to)
        all logs from category and specified levels will be ignored... (unless there are more specific handlers)
        Parameters:
        category - the log category.
        from - from log level.
        to - to log level.
        Returns:
        a registration handle to allow you to undo this filtering.

      • expect

        @CheckReturnValue
public LogAssert expect(String category,
                                          Level minimumLogLevel,
                                          org.hamcrest.Matcher<LogRecord>... matchers)
        Create an log expectation that can be asserted like: LogAssert expect = TestLoggers.expect("org.spf4j.test", Level.ERROR, Matchers.hasProperty("format", Matchers.equalTo("Booo"))); LOG.error("Booo", new RuntimeException()); expect.assertObservation();
        Parameters:
        category - the category under which we should expect these messages.
        minimumLogLevel - minimum log level of expected log messages
        matchers - a succession of LogMessages with each matching a Matcher is expected.
        Returns:
        an assertion handle.

      • expect

public LogAssert expect(String category,
                                          Level minimumLogLevel,
                                          long timeout,
                                          TimeUnit unit,
                                          org.hamcrest.Matcher<LogRecord>... matchers)

      • dontExpect

        @CheckReturnValue
public LogAssert dontExpect(String category,
                                              Level minimumLogLevel,
                                              org.hamcrest.Matcher<LogRecord>... matchers)
        the opposite of expect.
        Parameters:
        category - the category under which we should expect these messages.
        minimumLogLevel - minimum log level of expected log messages
        matchers - a succession of LogMessages with each matching a Matcher is NOT expected.
        Returns:
        an assertion handle.

      • expect

        public LogAssert expect(String category,
                        Level minimumLogLevel,
                        int nrTimes,
                        org.hamcrest.Matcher<LogRecord>... matchers)
        Ability to assert is you expect a sequence of logs to be repeated.
        Parameters:
        category - the log category (a.b.c)
        minimumLogLevel - the minimum log level of expected messages.
        nrTimes - number of time the sequence should appear.
        matchers - the sequence of matchers.
        Returns:
        the assertion handle.

        public LogAssert expect(String category,
                        Level minimumLogLevel,
                        int nrTimes,
                        long timeout,
                        TimeUnit unit,

public LogAssert expectUncaughtException(long timeout,
                                               TimeUnit unit,
                                               org.hamcrest.Matcher<UncaughtExceptionDetail> matcher)
        Assert uncaught exceptions.(from threads)
        Parameters:
        timeout - timeout to wait for this assertion. from the point in time of assertion invocation.
        unit -
        matcher - the exception matcher.
        Returns:
        the assertion handle.

      • collect

        public LogCollection<ArrayDeque<LogRecord>> collect(Level minimumLogLevel,
                                                    int maxNrLogs,
                                                    boolean collectPrinted)
        Collect up to a number of log messages.
        Parameters:
        minimumLogLevel - the minimum log level of the messages.
        maxNrLogs - the max number of messages to collect.
        collectPrinted - collect messages that have been printed or not.
        Returns:
        the collection of messages.
